description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows cryptographic services security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-30098), it is essential to apply the relevant security updates as provided by Microsoft. These updates resolve the issues related to the use of a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm.

1. Visit the Microsoft Update Catalog link for the appropriate KB articles.
2. Download the updates that correspond to your Windows version.
3. Install the updates manually if they aren’t automatically applied via Windows Update.
4. Restart your system to ensure all changes take effect.

**Updates Available**:
- For Windows 11 Version 23H2 and 22H2: [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
- For Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
- For additional configurations and updates, refer to [KB5040448](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040448) and [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427).

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system is updated to a supported version of Windows 10 or Windows 11.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with installations.

These actions will mitigate the identified vulnerability effectively.
